iba a ser pequeñito, pero no han pasado ni 2 meses y ya tiene el porte de

Borgoña, ajajaja!!  ¡Saludos!﻿

Me regalaron una conejita que al principio era muy tranquila y conforme a 
ido creciendo si intento cargarla me patalea mucho y me aruña, se porque se

comments.author: Adryz Jordison

comments.text:
+Adryz Jordison Este tipo de comportamiento se desencadena durante el celo, 
y considerando que los conejos tienen celo continuo, eso quiere decir que 
si no los castras, siempre lo haran o hasta se pondran mas agresivos. 
recomendamos la castracion.

top_comment.text:
Hola Antonio, soy una fiel seguidora de vuestros videos. Y os queria 
preguntar una duda que tengo, bueno yo tengo una coneja y una cobaya macho 
que se llevan muy bien, la conejita es belier pero tiene una particularidad 
una de sus orejas es azul celeste, es normal?﻿
top_comment.author: malena gonzalez gutierrez

comments.text:
+CyPmascota Hola nada la lleve al vete y me dijo que estaba perfecta que no 
me preocupara :-) eso sii que se me olvido decir el otro dia el tono azul 
es por la parte interior de la orejita. Muchas gracias de todas formas y un 
saludo
comments.author: malena gonzalez gutierrez

comments.text:
Hola Malena, si no es un moraton, no te tienes que preocupar. Si ves que le 
molesta, se rasca o no levanta esa oreja, tendras que llevarla a un 
veterinario.
comments.author: CyPmascota

top_comment.text:
Os rogaría que vigilaseis la forma de coger a los conejos... cuartos 
traseros en una mano y la otra sujetando el peso a la altura de las patas 
delanteras. Su espalda es mucho más frágil que la de un perro o un gato. Y 
ni mucho menos por el pellejo del cuello. Tampoco les suele gustar que los 
manoseen de una forma tan poco delicada, resulta bastante estresante...﻿
top_comment.author: mu1138

comments.text:
+CyPmascota Gracias por vuestra respuesta, espero que no os haya 
molestado... Un saludo y enhorabuena por vuestro trabajo :)
comments.author: mu1138

comments.text:
Gracias mu1138, tienes razón, así que cogen a los conejos.
No obstante el conejo prácticamente pesaba más que nuestra guapísima 
ayudante... Se le hacía complicado cogerlo bien.
Un saludo.
comments.author: CyPmascota

captions.text: Subscribe to our english channel: Everything about your pet.
https://www.youtube.com/user/allaboutyourpet
Hi, you've catched me having a snack with my friend Marionna.
She's here in the studio because she's told that she has a pet, and it seems
to be very special, and that we can't miss it.
So, Marionna,
I'm curious...Tell us, Which is this pet you have that's so special?
A rabbit
And, What's your rabbit's name? Mamut.
And, Where is Mamut? He's over there.
¡Wow!
¡What a rabbit!
¡My godness!
Hello, Mamut.
Friends, this super rabbit that Marionna has bought us, Mamut, is a giant
Flandes. There exists various giant rabbit breeds as pets and
the thing is that they have a very singular character, because the rabbits, the
bigger they are,
more calm they become. The only thing is, you have to have a super cage
or have a a super garden
and give them super feed
because, as you can see,
it is an animal that can weigh
nearly 12 kilos and there exists some special breed that can be even bigger.
And imagine, this is
almost the size of a dog, so when feeding it
get a lot of feed ready
And also, have a very big cage ready. Just imagine...
He's spectacular.
Come on Marionna, you pick up the big one...
Can you? Come on.
And I will carry,
uffff
uff, uff, he's so heavy!
Come on. Let's go back.
so here, the second monster.
I've bought a normal rabbit
so you can see the difference
between the size of a normal rabbit, this one is now
about three months old,
with this giant rabbit one year old. This one
is a butterfly, a giant butterfly.
And Marionna wants to show us two other super rabbits
so we will go and fetch them, let's go again.
Come on, perfect.
Lets go.
Can you cope?
We will place them all together so our
friends can see them.

Here you have a Leonardo of
Borgoña
and a giant Lop ear.
The difference, apart from their colours is that the Lop ear, is just like a standard Lop ear
that you all know, with ears down,  like donkey's ears,
and they all have in common their spectacular size. I want to
show you the difference that exists between the
rabbits that we are used to have as pets
and the beautiful basket players
that we have here. As I've told you, these are bred and
selected in CUNIPIC and these pets are exlusive, and are very
peaceful, see how calm they are. Many people are
scared of them, but they are really the most quiet and calm rabbits that exists.
The bigger the size,
more calm and better pets.
All you need is a lot of space
and a lot of food.
